Articles.Content:
@Malah , a bug report for QuickMute 1.0.9 in KSP 1.1.3. If KSP is muted when you launch a vehicle from VAB/SPH, and then un-mute it, the engine sounds are not coming back on. If a new engine is enabled (for example, through staging), that engine will be audible again.

If this bug was fixed in the later versions, then please excuse me - I still haven't migrated to KSP 1.1.2. Reporting just in case you want to check it out

3 hours ago, Malah said:

There's already this feature on QuickStart for EVE, can you try to put the delay on the settings to 5 seconds ? (if it works, I will added Sci Fi pack to the 5 seconds default option).

 gotcha - I'll report back in a moment if it works

Hello. I love Quick iva and Quick hide, they make RPM even more enjoyable. I have small request if you dont mind. Could you add config options for autohide every element of stock ui.  I prefer to not see any ui when piloting using RPM but sometimes I just need to look at something real quick. The way it works for stock app bar is perfect. Can you add it to rest of stock ui?

Edited December 30, 2016 by EmielRegis

4 hours ago, EmielRegis said:

Hello. I love Quick iva and Quick hide, they make RPM even more enjoyable. I have small request if you dont mind. Could you add config options for autohide every element of stock ui.  I prefer to not see any ui when piloting using RPM but sometimes I just need to look at something real quick. The way it works for stock app bar is perfect. Can you add it to rest of stock ui?

Thanks for this kind of idea, I can't do it soon, but it will be on my planned functions.

I installed QuickIVA and the settings menu at the KSC is blank. So i cant change any of the settings, do you guys know of a fix?

http://imgur.com/RXXbfWZ

Logs ...

@malah

File as requested: http://www.filedropper.com/installed-default

I have been been attempting to find out myself by removing mods. but haven't hit the jackpot yet. The functionality all appears to be there. My brakes are on at launch and I can amend SAS by the numpad etc however without being able to action the quick iva gui unable to change hotkeys and the like.

Thank you for any help

On 1/7/2017 at 6:49 AM, Malah said:

Logs ...

http://www.filedropper.com/outputlog_10

I believe the issue was caused by the AnomalySurveyor contract pack 

I wouldn't understand the how etc, but when I removed this, everything worked again.

16 hours ago, WhitestWizard said:

I believe the issue was caused by the AnomalySurveyor contract pack 

I wouldn't understand the how etc, but when I removed this, everything worked again. 

Thanks for the time passed, it's the only mod you have which made this error? As this mod isn't officially compatible for KSP 1.2, it doesn't help me to try to find the incompatibility.

17 hours ago, xNeil Armstrong said:

http://www.filedropper.com/outputlog_10

Same error as others ...

For some reason QuickStart is continously throwing a ReflectionTypeLoadException when loading up my highly modded install.

However, QuickStart is running fine on a low modded install, was running fine on the highly modded install and was not updated. So I assume this is a error related to other mods or the combination of mods.

Does anyone have an idea in which direction I should search? I tried reinstalling Quickstart and removing the mods which were the latest updates but this doesn't helped.

EDIT: Just recognized thats the same error already reported here. OK, then I will try to find the conflicting mod if I find time. BTW, what's a ReflectionTypeLoadException?
Strange thing is, the other reports here in the thread are older, but QS was working yesterday for me. No errors in the old logs (Using KSPDEV Logging Mod). Never had this before.

EDIT2: OK, after shredding my 170 mod install down to 40, I've got it. For any reason ShowFPS was installed. I Installed it in ANOTHER KSP-install today but it seems I have installed it accidently into my highly modded install. Removing it and the (my) error is gone.

Edited January 12, 2017 by Jebs_SY

This bug is an incompatibility with LanguageAPI and mods which are not updated for the last version of KSP.
I will update the API to correct this bug ...

But the good question is why you play with un-updated mods ?

I've corrected all QuickMods which support LanguageAPI : QuickIVA, QuickMute, QuickExit, QuickSearch, QuickHide, QuickSAS, QuickBrake, QuickContracts, QuickStart, QuickRevert and QuickGoTo.

If you prefer GitHub : QuickMods.

Changelog:

  • Fix: Corrected the error with LanguageAPI and unloaded plugins.

Malah, I had an interesting thought for QuickStart. Would it be possible to use the font and color that the main menu options are written in? That blocky yellow font? It would make it look a bit more fine tuned if it matched the in-game dialogues more. Just a thought.

17 hours ago, Avera9eJoe said:

Malah, I had an interesting thought for QuickStart. Would it be possible to use the font and color that the main menu options are written in? That blocky yellow font? It would make it look a bit more fine tuned if it matched the in-game dialogues more. Just a thought.

It's an idea, I will add it on a futur version but it won't be done soon, sorry.

1 minute ago, Malah said:

It's an idea, I will add it on a futur version but it won't be done soon, sorry.

Aye I can understand that. The mod works great right now and since it's just a cosmetic improvement it isn't in any rush.

I'm just curious, is there a way to make QuickBrake not automatically turn off the brakes as soon as you activate a stage?

 

for example, launching a jet and letting the engines warm up, then manually releasing the brake.  rather than engine start -> have to enable brakes again.

Edited January 31, 2017 by TK421d

On 31/01/2017 at 7:57 PM, TK421d said:

I'm just curious, is there a way to make QuickBrake not automatically turn off the brakes as soon as you activate a stage?

 

for example, launching a jet and letting the engines warm up, then manually releasing the brake.  rather than engine start -> have to enable brakes again.

I think it's a bug thanks (After thinking no it was a feature I will add a new option for this ) already done ...

Edited February 4, 2017 by Malah

On 31/01/2017 at 7:57 PM, TK421d said:

I'm just curious, is there a way to make QuickBrake not automatically turn off the brakes as soon as you activate a stage?

 

for example, launching a jet and letting the engines warm up, then manually releasing the brake.  rather than engine start -> have to enable brakes again.

I had forgotten that this feature was done, you just have to disable the Un Brake At Launch option ...

On 7/4/2016 at 10:22 AM, gerishnakov said:

I recently used QuickStart to jump straight to a vessel, and once I had control I found that all my contract progression had been reset. I'm on KSP 1.1.3 and my version of QuickStart is up to date.

I have this problem, here is a log of it happening:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0STyNDHlUuyRS0tdGFMaHVsX0U

Many people are probably getting this and dont know its from quickstart. In 1.2.2 and up to date.
